activity.activityName: titanium sponge production, from titanium tetrachloride
activity.includedActivitiesStart: The activity starts with the processing of high-purity titanium tetrachloride (TiCl4).
activity.includedActivitiesEnd: The activity ends with the production of titanium sponge with an average purity of 99.9%. MgCl2 is produced as byproduct and is sent to an electrolysis process (modelled in a separate activity) in order to recover the magnesium and chlorine. The magnesium is refined and recycled back to the distillation and reduction process for producing titanium sponge, while the chlorine is recycled back to the chlorination process for the production of TiCl4.

generalComment.text: This dataset refers to the average global production of 1 kg of titanium sponge from titanium tetrachloride (TiCl4+ 2Mg -> Ti + 2MgCl2), which is produced from the chlorination and refining process (first step of the Kroll process) followed by reduction with magnesium and a vacuum distillation (second step of the Kroll process) and is based on the Gao et al (2018) publication.

This dataset has been approximated from the respective dataset from the geography CN. The data is assumed to be representative also of the global situation, since the Kroll process is the most common method for the production of titanium sponge.

Gao, F., Nie, Z., Yang, D., Sun, B., Liu, Y., Gong, X., & Wang, Z. (2018). Environmental impacts analysis of titanium sponge production using Kroll process in China. Journal of Cleaner Production, 174, 771-779. doi:https://doi.org/10.1016/j.jclepro.2017.09.240.

classification.classificationValue: 2420:Manufacture of basic precious and other non-ferrous metals

comment.text: The dataset has been approximated from the respective dataset from CN. The data is assumed to be representative also of the global situation, since the Kroll process is the most common method for the production of titanium sponge.

After the production of high-purity TiCl4, it enters the reduction and distillation process, where it is firstly reduced by adding magnesium and then vacuum-distilled, producing the so-called titanium sponge and magnesium chloride as a byproduct based on the following stoichiometric equation: TiCl4 + 2Mg -> Ti + 2MgCl2. The magnesium chloride is then separated via the electrolysis process (modelled in a separate activity) and produces magnesium and chlorine. After refining, the magnesium is recycled and serves again as input to the reduction and distillation process, while chlorine (after it is filtrated and purified) is recycled and sent back to the chlorination process as an input.
Data are considered representative of current production practices. The data are assumed to be valid on average for 5 years after the publication of that article.

intermediateExchange.name: titanium sponge

property.name: carbon content, fossil
property.comment: fossil carbon content on a dry matter basis

property.name: carbon content, non-fossil
property.comment: biogene carbon content on a dry matter basis

property.name: price
property.comment: Assumed equal to 90% of price of titanium.

property.name: titanium content
property.comment: titanium content on a dry matter basis

property.name: water content
property.comment: water content on a dry matter basis

property.name: water in wet mass
property.comment: water content on a wet matter basis

intermediateExchange.productionVolumeComment: The production volume is expressed in kg. The global annual production (2019) of titanium sponge is 200000000 kg. Source: https://pubs.usgs.gov/periodicals/mcs2021/mcs2021-titanium.pdf

classification.classificationValue: 41601: Tungsten, molybdenum, tantalum, magnesium, cobalt, cadmium, titanium, zirconium, beryllium, gallium, hafnium, [â€¦]
810890: Titanium; other than unwrought, n.e.c. in heading no. 8108

intermediateExchange.name: chemical factory, organics
intermediateExchange.comment:
This infrastructural input has been included for compliance with the ecoinvent Guidelines and was not originally present in the publication on which this dataset is based (Gao et al. 2018). The chemical factory is assumed to have an average output of 50'000 t/a and a lifespan of 50 years.
Reference: Gao, F., Nie, Z., Yang, D., Sun, B., Liu, Y., Gong, X., & Wang, Z. (2018). Environmental impacts analysis of titanium sponge production using Kroll process in China. Journal of Cleaner Production, 174, 771-779. doi:https://doi.org/10.1016/j.jclepro.2017.09.240.

intermediateExchange.name: electricity, medium voltage
intermediateExchange.comment:
The original amount of electricity required in the reduction and distillation process is 4.85E+03 kWh and represents the amount required for the production of 1 metric ton of titanium sponge (Table 2 in Gao et al. (2018)). This value was scaled to represent the production of 1 kg of titanium sponge.
Reference: Gao, F., Nie, Z., Yang, D., Sun, B., Liu, Y., Gong, X., & Wang, Z. (2018). Environmental impacts analysis of titanium sponge production using Kroll process in China. Journal of Cleaner Production, 174, 771-779. doi:https://doi.org/10.1016/j.jclepro.2017.09.240.

Reference: Gao, F., Nie, Z., Yang, D., Sun, B., Liu, Y., Gong, X., & Wang, Z. (2018). Environmental impacts analysis of titanium sponge production using Kroll process in China. Journal of Cleaner Production, 174, 771-779. doi:https://doi.org/10.1016/j.jclepro.2017.09.240.

(2018)). This value was scaled to represent the production of 1 kg of titanium sponge.
Reference: Gao, F., Nie, Z., Yang, D., Sun, B., Liu, Y., Gong, X., & Wang, Z. (2018). Environmental impacts analysis of titanium sponge production using Kroll process in China. Journal of Cleaner Production, 174, 771-779. doi:https://doi.org/10.1016/j.jclepro.2017.09.240.

(2018)). This value was scaled to represent the production of 1 kg of titanium sponge.

intermediateExchange.comment:
The original amount of electricity required in the reduction and distillation process is 4.85E+03 kWh and represents the amount required for the production of 1 metric ton of titanium sponge (Table 2 in Gao et al. (2018)). This value was scaled to represent the production of 1 kg of titanium sponge.
Reference: Gao, F., Nie, Z., Yang, D., Sun, B., Liu, Y., Gong, X., & Wang, Z. (2018). Environmental impacts analysis of titanium sponge production using Kroll process in China. Journal of Cleaner Production, 174, 771-779. doi:https://doi.org/10.1016/j.jclepro.2017.09.240.

intermediateExchange.name: inert waste
intermediateExchange.comment:
Proxy considered for the output ''other residue'' that comes out of the process as a byproduct.
Stoichiometrically (based on the equationTiCl4 + 2Mg =Ti + 2MgCl2), approximately 1.0155 kg of Mg is required and 3.978 kg of MgCl2 is produced as a byproduct. However, due to electrolysis of the MgCl2 (MgCl2 = Mg + Cl2) 96% of the magnesium is recycled back to the reduction process and 45% of the chlorine is recycled back to the chlorination and refining process (see the titanium tetrachloride production dataset).
The non-recovered amounts of Cl (1.62 kg per kg of Ti sponge) and Mg (0.41 kg per kg of Ti sponge) need to be supplied externally. This means that in the end, these non-recovered amounts (1.62 + 0.041 = 1.661 kg) are lost.
Gao et al. (2018) report that 9.30E+01 kg of "other residue" is produced by the reduction and distillation process (per metric ton of titanium sponge). It is assumed that this residue represents magnesium chloride that is lost in this step. Therefore, the amount of waste is 0.093 kg, meaning that the rest of the MgCl2 (3.885 kg) is sent to the electrolysis step, where the other losses occur.
Reference: Gao, F., Nie, Z., Yang, D., Sun, B., Liu, Y., Gong, X., & Wang, Z. (2018). Environmental impacts analysis of titanium sponge production using Kroll process in China. Journal of Cleaner Production, 174, 771-779. doi:https://doi.org/10.1016/j.jclepro.2017.09.240.

property.name: price
property.comment: Waste products are assigned a price of zero as they are assumed to require further treatment.

intermediateExchange.productionVolumeComment: Calculated from production volume of reference product using the relative outputs.

intermediateExchange.name: inert waste
intermediateExchange.comment:
Proxy considered for the output ''other residue'' that comes out of the process as a byproduct.
Stoichiometrically (based on the equationTiCl4 + 2Mg =Ti + 2MgCl2), approximately 1.0155 kg of Mg is required and 3.978 kg of MgCl2 is produced as a byproduct. However, due to electrolysis of the MgCl2 (MgCl2 = Mg + Cl2) 96% of the magnesium is recycled back to the reduction process and 45% of the chlorine is recycled back to the chlorination and refining process (see the titanium tetrachloride production dataset).
The non-recovered amounts of Cl (1.62 kg per kg of Ti sponge) and Mg (0.41 kg per kg of Ti sponge) need to be supplied externally. This means that in the end, these non-recovered amounts (1.62 + 0.041 = 1.661 kg) are lost.
Gao et al. (2018) report that 9.30E+01 kg of "other residue" is produced by the reduction and distillation process (per metric ton of titanium sponge). It is assumed that this residue represents magnesium chloride that is lost in this step. Therefore, the amount of waste is 0.093 kg, meaning that the rest of the MgCl2 (3.885 kg) is sent to the electrolysis step, where the other losses occur.
Reference: Gao, F., Nie, Z., Yang, D., Sun, B., Liu, Y., Gong, X., & Wang, Z. (2018). Environmental impacts analysis of titanium sponge production using Kroll process in China. Journal of Cleaner Production, 174, 771-779. doi:https://doi.org/10.1016/j.jclepro.2017.09.240.

property.name: price
property.comment: Waste products are assigned a price of zero as they are assumed to require further treatment.

intermediateExchange.productionVolumeComment: Calculated from production volume of reference product using the relative outputs.

intermediateExchange.name: magnesium
intermediateExchange.comment:
The stoichiometric amount of Mg is based on the following equation: TiCl4 + 2Mg -> Ti + 2MgCl2. Approximately 1.0155 kg of Mg are required as an input for the production of 1 kg of Ti and 3.978 kg of MgCl2 is produced as byproduct.
However, in the Kroll process for titanium sponge production, approximately 96% of magnesium is recovered through the MgCl2 electrolysis process (MgCl2 -> Mg + Cl2) and reused as input to the reduction and distillation process, meaning that only 4% of the stoichiometric input needs to be added from an external source.
The amount of 41 kg Mg represents the amount of non-recovered magnesium that must be added per metric ton of Ti sponge, as reported in Table 2 in Gao et al. (2018). The rest of the Mg required for the reaction is obtained by the recycling of MgCl2.
Reference: Gao, F., Nie, Z., Yang, D., Sun, B., Liu, Y., Gong, X., & Wang, Z. (2018). Environmental impacts analysis of titanium sponge production using Kroll process in China. Journal of Cleaner Production, 174, 771-779. doi:https://doi.org/10.1016/j.jclepro.2017.09.240

classification.classificationValue: 41601: Tungsten, molybdenum, tantalum, magnesium, cobalt, cadmium, titanium, zirconium, beryllium, gallium, hafnium, [â€¦]
810490: Magnesium; articles n.e.c. in heading no. 8104

intermediateExchange.name: magnesium chloride, from titanium sponge production
intermediateExchange.comment:
Calculated based on the stoichiometric reaction and assumed losses. Based on the reaction TiCl4 + 2Mg -> Ti + 2MgCl2, 3.978 kg of MgCl2 is produced as byproduct.
Table 2 in Gao et al. (2018) reports that 0.093 kg of "other residue" is produced during the reduction and distillation step. It is assumed that this flow represents MgCl2 that is lost. Therefore, the amount of magnesium chloride that is sent to the electrolysis step is 3.885 kg per kg of titanium sponge.
Reference: Gao, F., Nie, Z., Yang, D., Sun, B., Liu, Y., Gong, X., & Wang, Z. (2018). Environmental impacts analysis of titanium sponge production using Kroll process in China. Journal of Cleaner Production, 174, 771-779. doi:https://doi.org/10.1016/j.jclepro.2017.09.240

property.comment: chlorine content on a dry matter basis

property.name: magnesium content
property.comment: magnesium content on a dry matter basis

property.name: price
property.comment: Price calculated based on prices from wholesalers on alibaba.com (accessed on 2021-09-03). The average price based on 5 sellers is 139 $/Ton (assumed to be metric ton). This price was converted to EUR based on the annual exchange rates published by the European Central Bank (https://sdw.ecb.europa.eu/quickview.do?SERIES_KEY=120.EXR.A.USD.EUR.SP00.A), and then adjusted for inflation relative to 2005 by using the Harmonised Index of Consumer Prices (HICP) of the euro area, published by eurostat (https://ec.europa.eu/eurostat/databrowser/view/PRC_HICP_AIND/default/table).

282590: Inorganic bases, metal oxides, hydroxides and peroxides; n.e.c. in heading no. 2825

intermediateExchange.name: magnesium, for reuse in titanium sponge production
intermediateExchange.comment:
Calculated amount, which corresponds to the magnesium that is recovered from the electrolysis of magnesium chloride which is produced as byproduct.
The stoichiometric amount of Mg is based on the following equation: TiCl4 + 2Mg -> Ti + 2MgCl2. Approximately 1.0155 kg of Mg are required as an input for the production of 1 kg of Ti and 3.978 kg of MgCl2 is produced as byproduct.
However, in the Kroll process for titanium sponge production, approximately 96% of magnesium is recovered through the MgCl2 electrolysis process (MgCl2 -> Mg + Cl2) and reused as input to the reduction and distillation process, while the remaining Mg (0.041 kg) is obtained from an external source.
Reference: Gao, F., Nie, Z., Yang, D., Sun, B., Liu, Y., Gong, X., & Wang, Z. (2018). Environmental impacts analysis of titanium sponge production using Kroll process in China. Journal of Cleaner Production, 174, 771-779. doi:https://doi.org/10.1016/j.jclepro.2017.09.240

810411: Magnesium; unwrought, containing at least 99.8% by weight of magnesium

intermediateExchange.name: titanium tetrachloride
intermediateExchange.comment: The amount of TiCl4 required is based on the stoichiometric equation: TiCl4 + 2Mg -> Ti + 2MgCl2 (reduction and distillation process), which means that for the production of 1 kg of Ti sponge, 3.9626 kg of TiCl4 are needed. An activity link has been set in order to ensure supply from producing activities of the same geography.

classification.classificationValue: 34250: Salts of oxometallic or peroxometallic acids; colloidal precious metals and compounds thereof; inorganic and o[â€¦]
282739: Chlorides; other than of ammonium, calcium, magnesium, aluminium and nickel

representativeness.samplingProcedure:
The individual exchanges have been taken from Table 2 of Gao et al. (2018).
The individual emissions reported in Gao et al. (2018) (As, Cd, Cr, Hg, Ni, Pb, V, Zn, CO2, SO2, NOx, CO, CH4, N2O, NMVOC) are all assumed to be related to energy production. Therefore they are not considered here because they are modelled in the ecoinvent dataset for electricity production.
Infrastructure has been included for compliance with the ecoinvent guidelines and was not originally contained in the abovementioned source.
An activity link has been set to the Ti tetrachloride, to ensure that the Ti tetrachloride is supplied from the producing activity of the same geography.
Furthermore, due to the electrolysis process, Mg and Cl2 are produced from the MgCl2 byproduct, which is produced during the production of Ti sponge. These 2 products are recycled and fed back to the respective production processes (Mg is fed back to the reduction process and Cl2 to the chlorination and refining process, i.e., the titanium tetrachloride production dataset). In Gao et al. (2018), only the added amounts (non-recycled amounts) have been reported (0.041 kg for Mg and 1.62 kg for Cl2 per kg of produced Ti sponge) This lost 1.661 kg of Mg and Cl2 is assumed to be lost partly in this process in the form of MgCl2, for which inert waste is used as proxy. The amount (0.093 kg) is based on the "other residue" reported in Table 2 in Gao et al. (2018). The other losses of Mg and Cl are assumed to occur in the magnesium chloride electrolysis step.
Reference: Gao, F., Nie, Z., Yang, D., Sun, B., Liu, Y., Gong, X., & Wang, Z. (2018). Environmental impacts analysis of titanium sponge production using Kroll process in China. Journal of Cleaner Production, 174, 771-779. doi:https://doi.org/10.1016/j.jclepro.2017.09.240.
representativeness.extrapolations: This dataset has been extrapolated from the respective dataset from CN. The uncertainty has been adjusted accordingly. According to the authors of the publication used as a source for this dataset, data were collected from titanium sponge manufacturing companies in the province of Sichuan and Shaanxi through surveys, but considering at the same time average national production statistics. Therefore, the data are assumed to represent the average production of titanium metal in China through the Kroll process. The data is assumed to be representative also of the global situation, since the Kroll process is the most common method for the production of titanium sponge.

review.otherDetails:
Validation warnings:
- Mass and/or economic deficit in activity dataset exceeds either 0.1% of input or output sum:
Property 'dry mass': - Input='4.073425608', Output='2.661' - Input > output by 1.412425608 kg (53.08% of output)
Property 'wet mass': - Input='4.073425608', Output='2.661' - Input > output by 1.412425608 kg (53.08% of output)
- Uncertainty shall always be provided for all primary data inputs (exchange amounts, properties and parameters), except for the amount and properties of reference products. -- Property(ies): wet mass=1, water in wet mass=0, water content=0, carbon content, fossil=0, carbon content, non-fossil=0, dry mass=1

Validation warnings:
- Uncertainty shall always be provided for all primary data inputs (exchange amounts, properties and parameters), except for the amount and properties of reference products. -- Property(ies): water in wet mass=0, dry mass=1, wet mass=1, carbon content, fossil=0, carbon content, non-fossil=0, water content=0, wet mass=1, dry mass=1, water content=0, water in wet mass=0, carbon content, fossil=0, carbon content, non-fossil=0, magnesium content=0.255299036, chlorine content=0.7447
- Pedigree information shall always be provided for all uncertainties of primary data inputs (exchange amounts, properties and parameters), except for the amount and properties of reference products. -- Property(ies): water in wet mass=0, dry mass=1, wet mass=1, carbon content, fossil=0, carbon content, non-fossil=0, water content=0, wet mass=1, dry mass=1, water content=0, water in wet mass=0, carbon content, fossil=0, carbon content, non-fossil=0, magnesium content=0.255299036, chlorine content=0.7447
- For by-products/wastes, a market activity (currently missing) that supplies the output 'magnesium chloride, from titanium sponge production' must exist for a geographical area and time period including the location and time period of the activity. If the the market dataset is not available the dataset will be put on hold at the end of its review and will remain on hold until such a market dataset has been accepted into the ecoinvent database. - The input exchange 'magnesium, for reuse in titanium sponge production' does not have an activity link and therefore requires a market for that input to be available. If the market is not available the dataset will be put on hold at the end of its review and will remain on hold until such a market has been accepted into the ecoinvent database.
- The output exchange 'magnesium chloride, from titanium sponge production' has an activity link and therefore requires a valid product exchange for that output to be available. If the valid product exchange is not available the dataset will be put on hold at the end of its review and will remain on hold until such a valid product exchange has been accepted into the ecoinvent database.
